sentence: Bargain hunters are wise to pay careful attention to insider buying, because although there are many various reasons for an insider to sell a stock, presumably the only reason they would use their hard-earned cash to make a purchase, is that they expect to make money.
Today we look at two noteworthy recent insider buys.
At Home Depot ( HD ), a filing with the SEC revealed that on Wednesday, Director Gregory D. Brenneman bought 16,827 shares of HD, at a cost of $178.29 each, for a total investment of $3.00M.
Investors have the opportunity to grab HD even cheaper than Brenneman did, with the stock trading as low as $175.85 at last check today which is 1.4% under Brenneman's purchase price.
Home Depot is trading up about 0.9% on the day Friday.
And on Thursday, Director Francesco Trapani bought $1.47M worth of Tiffany & Co. ( TIF ), buying 15,000 shares at a cost of $98.11 a piece.
Before this latest buy, Trapani purchased TIF on 4 other occasions during the past twelve months, for a total cost of $15.64M at an average of $89.37 per share.
Tiffany & Co. is trading up about 0.9% on the day Friday.
Bargain hunters have the opportunity to snag TIF even cheaper than Trapani did, with the stock changing hands as low as $95.48 at last check today which is 2.7% below Trapani's purchase price.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
